data.text:
Seijuu Sentai Gingaman (translated as Star-Beast Task Force Galaxy Man) is the 22nd entry of Super Sentai. Its main motifs are nature and animals. Footage from the series was used for Power Rangers Lost Galaxy, which this article will also cover.

Please provide your own knowledge to this page if possible. Descriptions written in italics are speculation and not solid facts.

The Gingaman[]

Each Gingaman is based on an animal species and an element of nature. Their name generally alludes to their elemental power.

Ryoma[]

Alias: GingaRed

Motif: Lion, Fire

Elemental Attack: Mane of Fire (Hono no Tategami)

Seijuken Attack: Flame Flash (Hono Issen)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Leo Corbett

Etymology

Ryouma's name is officially written in katakana, which has no deeper meaning.

Leo is a masculine given name derived from the Latin word for a lion.

Corbett is an English surname derived from the French word "corbett" (meaning 'raven') which originally referred to someone with dark hair.

Hayate[]

Alias: GingaGreen

Motif: Falcon, Air

Elemental Attack: Fluttering Storm (Arashi no Habataki)

Seijuken Attack: Hurricane Gust (Shippu Ichijin)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Damon Henderson

Etymology

Hayate's name is officially written with katakana, which has no deeper meaning. The word itself is the Japanese word for a hurricane, gale, or gust of wind.

Damon is an English masculine given name which comes from the Greek word "damazein", meaning 'to overpower' or 'to conquer'.

Henderson is a Scottish surname which ultimately means 'son of Henry'.

Gouki[]

Alias: GingaBlue

Motif: Gorilla, Water

Elemental Attack: Pulse of the Stream (Ryusei no Kodo)

Seijuken Attack: Rapids Strike (Gekiryu Itto)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Kai Chen

Etymology

Gouki's name is officially written in katakana, which has no deeper meaning.

Kai is a gender-neutral given name (more common in males) with various meanings depending on the language. In Maori, the name means 'food' or 'meal'. It is a very popular name in Asian countries, with Japanese meanings including 'sea' and 'shell'.

Chen is a common Chinese surname which is one of the most popular in Asia. The Chinese character used most often to spell it can be translated as 'ancient' or 'to describe'.

Hikaru[]

Alias: GingaYellow

Motif: Wolf, Thunder

Elemental Attack: Howl of Lightning (Inazuma no Otakebi)

Seijuken Attack: Thunder Sweep (Ikazuchi Isso)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Maya

Etymology

Hikaru's name is officially written in katakana, which has no deeper meaning. The word itself is a Japanese verb meaning 'to shine'.

Maya is a feminine given name which means 'magic' or 'illusion' in Sanskrit, which is also an alternate name of the Hindu goddess Lakshmi.

Saya[]

Alias: GingaPink

Motif: Wildcat, Nature

Elemental Attack: Claws of Petals (Hanabira no Tsume)

Seijuken Attack: Flower Heart (Hana Isshin)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Kendrix Morgan

Etymology

Saya's given name is officially written in katakana, which has no deeper meaning. As a given name, it can be translated as meaning 'scabbard'. It can also be spelled using the Japanese kanji for "blossom".

Kendrix is a gender-neutral American given name which means 'bold ruler'.

Morgan is a Welsh, Irish, and Scottish surname derived from the Old Welsh given name "Morcant". It is believed to mean 'great kingdom' or 'great hundred'. Morgan is also the Welsh term for water spirits.

Yukiya[]

Created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer

Alias: GingaWhite

Motif: Walrus, Ice

Elemental Attack: Icicle Breaker (Tsurara no Nami)

Seijuken Attack: Icicle Point (Tsurara Ikkaku)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Tushar

Etymology

Yukiya is a Japanese given name that here means "snow covering".

Tushar is the Sanskrit word for snow or other words related to the Winter.

Arashi[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Alias: GingaViolet

Motif: Tyrannosaurus Rex, Cosmic

Elemental Attack: Roars of the cosmic (Uchu no Gaon)

Seijuken Attack: Hakuaki Kamu (Cretaceous Bite)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Raja

Ayahisa[]

Created and owned by Krahe2105

Alias: GingaCopper

Motifs: Elephant, Time

Elemental Attack: Seiki no Fumi (Century Stomp)

Seijuken Attack: Seiki Ippyo (Century Strike)

Power Rangers Counterpart: TBA

Etymology

Ayahisa's name is officially written with kanji meaning 'colorful long ago'.

Umbra[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Alias: GingaUmbra

Motifs: Crocodile, Shadow

Elemental Attack: Fangs of the Night (Yoru no Kiba)

Seijuto Attack: Tsuki Ikki (Moon Riot)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crescent

Etymology

Umbra is defined as 'the darkest part of a shadow, especially the cone-shaped region of full shadow cast by Earth, the Moon, or another body during an eclipse'. It is the Latin word for 'shadow'.

Crescent's name is a reference to the crescent moon.

Equipment[]

Ginga Brace[]

The Senshi no Udewa Ginga Brace (Warrior Bracelet Galaxy Brace) is the primary transformation device of the Gingamen which is a wrist-mounted device. The transformation is activated by turning the dial to the desired Ranger color before pressing the upper zigzag switch while shouting "Ginga Tensei!" (Galactic Rebirth!).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Transmorpher

Fubuki Brace[]

Created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer

The Eiyu no Udewa Fubuki Brace (Hero Bracelet Blizzard Brace) is the transformation device of GingaWhite which is a reskin of the original Ginga Brace. The transformation is activated by simply pressing the upper zigzag switch while shouting "Fubuki Tensei!" (Blizzard Rebirth!). This device can only be used to access the powers of GingaWhite, so it's dial section does not turn.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Tundraformer

Shinka Brace[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

The Kishi no Udewa Shinka Brace (Knight Bracelet Evolution Brace) is the transformation device of GingaViolet which is a reskinf of the original Ginga Brace. The transformation is activated by simply pressing the upper zigzag switch while shouting "Shinka Tensei!' (Evolution Rebirth). This device can only be used to access the powers of GingaViolet, so it's dial section does not turn.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Prehistoric Transmorpher

Kurayami Brace[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

The Ryoshi no Udewa Kurayami Brace (Hunter Bracelet Darkness Brace) is the transformation device of GingaUmbra which is a spiky, dark reskin of the original Ginga Brace. The transformation is activated by turning the dial 360 degrees before pressing the upper zigzag switch while shouting "Kurayami Tensei!" (Darkness Rebirth!).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crescent Transmorpher

Bull Riot[]

The Bull Riot is the transformation device of BullBlack, a sword which can combine with its sheath to form an energy rifle. The transformation is activated by raising the sword to the sky while shouting "Kishi Tensei!" (Knight Rebirth!).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Magna Blaster

Seijuken[]

The Seijuken (Star-Beast Sword) are the primary weapons of the Gingamen. They compress into the length of a dagger and extend into a full length sword when drawn. Channeling the power of the Earth through them allows the Gingamen to perform an elemental-based sword strike.

Etymology: In addition to the literal meaning, this weapon's name is also a pun on a "seiken" (the Japanese word for a holy sword).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Quasar Saber

Mechanical Blade Kiba[]

The Jizaiken Kiba (Machine Blade Fang) are fang-shaped blades that form into weapons for the Gingamen that can also be used to transform the Starbeasts into their Silver Starbeast forms. Each Gingamen prefers to wield their Kiba in a specific mode. When used together, they can perform the Kiba Imperial Wrath finisher.

The Kiba Cutter is the personal mode used by GingaRed, a shortsword that can perform the Fire Cut attack.

The Kiba Shot is the personal mode used by GingaGreen, a crossbow that can perform the Blast Shoot attack.

The Kiba Claw is the personal mode used by GingaBlue, a handheld claw that can perform the Tsunami Hit attack.

The Kiba Knives is the personal mode used by GingaYellow, a pair of short daggers that can perform the Lightning Cut attack.

The Kiba Arrow is the personal mode used by GingaPink, a longbow that has no special attack of its own.

The Kiba Edge is a special mode used by GingaWhite, a scythe that has no special attack of its own. The Kiba Edge is created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer.

The Kiba Chainsaw is a special mode used by GingaViolet, a chainsaw that can perform the Cosmic Crush attack. The Kiba Chainsaw is created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Power Rangers Counterpart: Transdaggers

Jugekibo[]

The Jugekibo (Beast Attack Rods) are large bazookas which can also transform into long staffs. When used together, they can perform the Ginga Jugekidan (Galaxy Beast Attack Bullet) finisher. They become upgraded while the Gingamen are in Beast Armor Shine Mode and can perform the stronger Senko Jugekidan (Flashing Beast Attack Bullet) finisher while in this form.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Quasar Launchers

Seijukto[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

The Seijuto (Star-Beast Blade) is the primary weapon of GingaUmbra. It compresses into the length of a dagger and extend into a full length sword when drawn. Channelling the power of the Earth through it allows GingaUmbra to perform an elemental-based sword strike.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crescent Quasar Saber

Jusoko Mode[]

Jusoko (Beast Armor Shine) is the Super Form of the Gingamen accessed via the Lights of Ginga and the command "Hoero! Ginga Hikari!" (Howl! Lights of Ginga!). While in this form, the Seijuken are upgraded into the Senko Seijuken (Flashing Star-Beast Swords) and the Gingamen equip the Juso no Tsume (Beast Armor Claw). Their team attack in this form is the Ginga Senko (Galaxy War Radiance).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Lights of Orion

Jusouyami Mode[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Jusouyami (Beast Armor Darkness) is the Super Form of the GingaUmbra accessed via the Shadows of Ginga and the command "Hoero! Ginga Kage!!" (Howl! Shadows of Ginga!). While in this form, the Seijukto is upgraded into the Shikkoku (Jet Black Star-Beast Blade) and GingaUmbra is equipped with the Kurai Juso no Tsume (Dark Beast Armor Claw). His Finishing Attack in this form is the Ginga Ankoku (Galaxy Darkness).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Shadows of Orion

Jusoba[]

The Jusoba (Beast Racehorses) are horses which serve as the main transportation of the Gingamen. Each one has a different name based on the classical element of their rider.

Red Spark (GingaRed)

Green Wind (GingaGreen)

Blue Horizon (GingaBlue)

Yellow Thunder (GingaYellow)

Pink Flower (GingaPink)

Galeo Pulsar[]

The Kidoba Galeo Pulsar (Mobile Steed Galeo Pulsar) is a motorcycle themed around a lion which is driven by GingaRed. It can perform the Lion War Blast attack as well as the Shishi no Soko (Lion Shining Armor) finisher.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Capsular Cycle

The Seijuu[]

The Seijuu (Starbeasts) are the personal companions of the Gingaman which can transform into the Ginseiju (Silver Starbeasts) Mecha by channeling their home plant's energy through the Kiba and shouting "Daitensei, Ginseiju!" (Great Rebirth, Silver Starbeasts!).

GingaLeon[]

Motif: African Lion

The lion (Panthera leo) is a large wild cat native to Africa which is an apex predator dubbed the "King of Beasts". It is known for its large furry head called a mane, although this trait is only present on males. It is one of the most recognized animal symbols in human culture and has been known as representing strength, nobility, and royalty. Their name derives from the Latin word "leo", which refers to the animal itself.

Home Planet: Galeon (Field Planet)

Special Attack: Goka (Strong Flame), Silver Flame (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Lion Galactabeast

Gingalcon[]

Motif: Peregrine Falcon

The peregrine falcon (Falco peregrinus) is a widespread bird of prey renowned for its speed. It has been recorded of reaching speeds of over 320 km/h (200 mph), making it the single fastest animal in the world. Their name comes from the Latin word "falco", which simply refers directly to this animal.

Home Planet: Galcon (Windy Planet)

Special Attack: Roaring Cyclone, Silver Cyclone (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Condor Galactabeast

Gingarilla[]

Motif: Mountain Gorilla

The gorilla is a genus of herbivorous great ape primates that live in the tropical forests of Africa. They are known as the largest living primates and the second closest biological relative to humans after chimpanzees. The name of the animal is derived from the Greek word "gorillai" meaning 'tribe of hairy women' and comes from the expeditions of explorer Hanno the Navigator whose fellow explorers used the word to refer to the African indigenous tribesman they encountered.

Home Planet: Garilla (Forest Planet)

Special Attack: Mighty Strength, Silver Blizzard (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Gorilla Galactabeast

GingaVerick[]

Motif: Wolf

The gray wolf (Canis lupus) is a large canine native to Eurasia and North America. They are the largest living canine species today, reaching weights of 40 kilograms (88 pounds). Its name derives from the Germanic word wulfaz, which refers to this animal.

Home Planet: Gaverick (Forest Planet)

Special Attack: Strong Electric Shock, Silver Flash (As Ginseiju, with Gingat)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Wolf Galactabeast

Gingat[]

Motif: Wildcat

Home Planet: Gat (Desert Planet)

Special Attack: Flower Bullet, Silver Flash (As Ginseiju, with Gingaverick)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Wildcat Galactabeast

GoTaurus[]

Motif: Bull

Bison are a number of large, even-toed ungulates in the genus of the same name. Only two species are still alive today; the American bison (Bison bison) and the European bison (Bison bonasus). The name means "wild ox" in Latin.

Home Planet: Taurus

Power Rangers Counterpart: Torozord

GingaRhinos[]

Motif: Rhinoceros

The rhinoceros, often abbreviated to rhino, is any of the five species of odd-toed ungulates in the Rhinocerotidae family that live in Africa and Southeast Asia. Members of the species are known for their single horn, gigantic size, and tough hide. Its name means "nose horn" in Greek.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Rhino Galactabeast

GingaPhoenix[]

Motif: Phoenix

The phoenix is a creature from Greek mythology that possesses analogs in the beliefs of many other cultures. It is a bird imbued with the element of fire that is a common symbol of immortality thanks to its famous ability to resurrect itself. The creature's name is believed to derive from the Greek word "phoinix", which can refer to the country of Phoenicia (also known as the land of the sunrise) or the color purple (which in ancient times was symbolic of fire).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Phoenix Galactabeast

GigaBitus[]

Motif: Shark

The great white shark, is a species of large marine animal that can be found in all major oceans. The success of the Steven Spielberg film Jaws has led to the great white being associated as a ferocious man-eating predator, despite humans not being its preferred prey. The exact origin of the word shark is uncertain, but one possible etymology is the Dutch word "schurk" which means 'villain, scoundrel'.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Zenith Carrierzord

Gingalrus[]

Created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer

Motif: Walrus

The walrus (Odobenus rosmarus) is a large flippered marine mammal that lives in the area around the North Pole in the coldest region of the world. It is characterized by its two large tusks and massive size. The origin of its name is Germanic, but the exact roots is inconclusive.

Home Planet: TBA

Special Attacks: TBA

Power Rangers Counterpart: Walrus Galactabeast

Gingarex[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Motif: Tyrannosaurus Rex

The Tyrannosaurus Rex is one of the represented dinosaurs of the theropod category. It lived during the Late Cretaceous period in western North America and was among the last non-avian-dinosaurs to ever live. Its name means "Tyrant Lizard King" in Greek

Home Planet: Garex (Dinosaur Planet)

Special Attack: Fang Bite, Tail Crusher

Power Rangers Counterpart: T Rex Galactabeast

Ginganodon[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Motif: Pteranodon

The Pteranodon is a genus of pterosaur that was one of the largest flying reptiles in history. It lived during the Late Cretaceous Period in North America around Kansas, Alabama, and Nebraska. Its name comes from Greek roots meaning 'wing' (pteron) and 'toothless' (anodon).

Home Planet: Ganodon (Island Planet)

Special Attack: Wings Of Fury, Sonic Boom

Power Rangers Counterpart: Pterodactyl Galactabeast

Gingachio[]

Created and ownd by Gabutyrafan2022

Motif: Brachiosaurus

The Brachiosaurus is a large sauropod dinosaur genus that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic. Its name means "arm lizard" in Greek, a reference to its long neck.

Home Planet: Gachio (Forest Planet)

Special Attack: Stomp Attack, Neck Strike

Power Rangers Counterpart: Brachiosaurus Galactabeast

Gingatops[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Motif: Triceratops

The Triceratops is a genus of herbivorous ceratopsian dinosaur that lived during the Late Cretaceous period in North America. It was present at the Cretaceous-Paleogene extinction event. Its name means "Three-Horned Face" in Greek.

Home Planet: Gatops (Grassland Planet)

Special Attack: Horn Charge, Leg Kick

Power Rangers Counterpart: Triceratops Galactabeast

Gingastego[]

Created and owned by Gabutyrafan2022

Motif: Stegosaurus

The Stegosaurus is an armored dinosaur known for its distinctive plated armor running down its back. It lived in the western United States and Portugal during the Late Jurassic. Its name means "roof lizard" in Greek.

Home Planet: Gastego (Mountain Planet)

Special Attack: Fin Strike, Tail Spike Crash

Power Rangers Counterpart: Stegosaurus Galactabeast

Gingaphant[]

Created and owned by Krahe2105

Motif: Elephant

The elephant is the name of the three living species of mammals belonging to the Elephantidae family. They are the largest living land animal on Earth and are known for their long proboscis called a trunk, large tusks, large flappy ears, and tough skin. Their name is derived from the Greek word "elephantos", which simply refers to this animal.

Home Planet: Gaphant (Jungle Planet)

Special Attack: Phant Gust, Silver Throwback (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Elephant Galactabeast

Gingadile[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Saltwater Crocodile

The saltwater crocodile (Crocodylus porosus) is a crocodilian native to saltwater habitats, brackish wetlands and freshwater rivers from India's east coast across Southeast Asia and the Sundaic region to northern Australia and Micronesia.

Home Planet: Gadile (Swamp Planet)

Special Attack: Fang Slash, Silver Snap (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crocodile Galactabeast

Gingabat[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Bat

The bat is the name of any mammalian animal in the Chiroptera order. They are the only living species of mammal capable of true flight and are actually more maneuverable than a bird. The bat is nocturnal, meaning they will sleep inside caves during the daytime and come out to hunt for food at night using a process called echolocation. Bats are often associated with negative concepts in the West like darkness, malevolence, and death. Their name derives from the Middle English word bakke.

Home Planet: Gabat (Cave Planet)

Special Attack: Sonic Swoop, Silver Sonar (As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Bat Galactabeast

Gingascorp[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Emperor Scorpion

The emperor scorpion, Pandinus imperator, is a species of scorpion native to rainforests and savannas in West Africa. It is one of the largest scorpions in the world and lives for 6â€“8 years. Its body is black, but like other scorpions it glows pastel green or blue under ultraviolet light.

Home Planet: Gapion (Dessert Planet)

Special Attack: Claw Snap, Silver Sting(As Ginseiju)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Scorpion Galactabeast

Giant Robo[]

GingaiOh[]

Japanese Name: Seijuu Gattai Ginga Jushi GingaiOh (Star-Beast Combination Galaxy Beast Warrior Silver Armor King)

Main Components: GingaLeon, Gingarilla, Gingalcon, Gingaverick, Gingat

Weapons: Gingaiken (Silver Armor Sword), Galcon Bowgun

Finishers: Ginga JuOh Kiri (Galaxy Beast King Cut), Ryuseidan (Meteor Bullet)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Galaxy Megazord

Ju Kishi BullBlack[]

General Information: This upgraded form of BullBlack is accessed when GoTaurus infuses its power into the warrior.

Weapons: Bull Swords

Finisher: Cross Fire Slash

Etymology: This name can be translated as 'Heavy Knight Bull Black'.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Mega Defender

BullTaurus[]

Japanese Name: Gasshin Jushi BullTaurus (Combined Beast-Warrior Bull Taurus)

Main Components: GoTaurus, Ju Kishi BullBlack

Weapons: Twin Bull Sword, Knight Axe

Finishers: Yagyu Eidan (Bison Fierce Cut), Daigyu Eidan (Great Bison Fierce Cut)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Defender Torozord

Chosoko GingaiOh[]

General Information: This upgraded form of the original GingaiOh is accessed through channeling the Lights of Ginga while in Jusoko Mode.

Weapons: Cho Gingaiken (Super Silver Armor Sword)

Finishers: Ginga Dai JuOh Kiri (Great Galaxy Beast King Cut), Ginga JuOh Ougi Kiri (Galaxy Beast King Unrelenting Cut)

Etymology: This Giant Robo's name can be translated as 'Super Armor Shine Silver Armor King'.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Orion Galaxy Megazord

GigaRhinos[]

Main Components: GigaWheels 1-5

Weapon: Gigantis Buster

Power Rangers Counterpart: Centaurus Megazord

GigaPhoenix[]

Main Components: GigaWings 1-5

Weapon: Giganic Boomerang

Power Rangers Counterpart: Stratoforce Megazord

TokenOh[]

Created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer

Name Subject to Change, More information to be added

KyoryuKaiser[]

Created and onwed by Gabutyrafan2022

Japanese Name: Seijuu Gattai Ginga Jushi KyoryuKaiser

Main Components: Gingarex, Ginganodon, Gingachio, Gingatops, Gingastego

Weapons: GingaShinkaKen

Finisher: Ginga Shinka Giri

Power Rangers Counterpart: Dino Galaxy Megazord

Chosoko KyoryuKaiser[]

Created and owned By Gabutyrafan2022

General Formation: This Upgraded form of the original KyoryuKaiser is accessed through channelling the Ancients Of Ginga while in Hakuaki Mode

Weapons: Cho GingaShinkaKen

Finishers: Ginga Daiju Shinka Giri

Power Rangers Counterpart: Orion Dino Galaxy Megazord

JidaiOh[]

Japanese Name: Seijuu Henkei Ginga Jushi JidaiOh (Star-Beast Transformation Galaxy Beast Warrior Era King)

Main Component: Gingaphant

Weapon: GinZousou (Silver Elephant Spear)

Finisher: GinZousou Ginga Tsuki (Silver Elephant Spear Galaxy Thrust)

Power Rangers Counterpart: TBA

GinkageOh[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Japanese Name: Seijuu Gattai Ginga Jushi GinkageOh (Star-Beast Combination Galaxy Beast Warrior Silver Shadow King)

Main Components: Gingator, Gingabat, Gingascorp

Weapons: Ginkageken (Silver Shadow Sword)

Finishers: Ginga JuRyoshi Waru (Galaxy Beast Hunter Cleave)

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crescent Galaxy Megazord

Chosoko GinkageOh[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

General Information: This upgraded form of the original GinkageOh is accessed through channelling the Shadows of Ginga while in Jusouyami Mode.

Weapons: Cho Ginkageken (Super Silver Shadow Sword)

Finishers: Ginga Dai JuRyoshi Waru (Galaxy Beast Hunter Cleave), Ginga JuOh Ougi Kiri (Galaxy Beast King Unrelenting Cut)

Etymology: This Giant Robo's name can be translated as 'Super Armor Shine Silver Shadow King'.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Orion Crescent Galaxy Megazord

Space Pirates Balban[]

The Space Pirates Balban (Uchu Kaizoku Baruban) is a group of intergalactic criminals that which to use the Demon Beast Daitanix to conquer the Earth. The entire organization possesses a pirate theme, while also being split into four different groups which possess their own motifs. The Monsters of the Week are overall referred to as Majin. The meaning of the organization's name is currently unknown at this time.

The names of the main villains are potentially derived from naval terms.

Captain Zahab[]

Role: Boss

Motif: Pirate, Pirate Ship

Etymology: Zahab's name is a corruption of Captain Ahab, the name of a character from the famous novel Moby Dick.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Captain Mutiny

Steerwoman Shelinda[]

Role: Navigator

Motif: Sea Shell

Etymology: Shelinda's name comes from a combination of the word "shell" and the female given name "Linda". The name may also be based on the Japanese word for the helm (sodarin).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Trakeena (Role)

Barreled Scholar Bucrates[]

Role: Right-Hand Man, Traitor

Motif: Unknown

Etymology: Bucrates' name comes from a combination the word "book" and "Socrates".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Kegler

Gun Boss Sambash[]

Role: General, Sambash Majin Gang Leader

Motif: Insect, Biker Gang Leader

Insects are invertebrates of the Arthropoda phylum. They are the most diverse group of animals in the world, with over a million described species currently documented. The word derives from the Latin word "insectum" (cut into), which references insects possessing three sections on their body.

Etymology: Sambash's name is likely based on the Japanese word for the pier (sanbashi), which is a raised structure that rises above the water and provides access to offshore areas.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Villamax

Sword General Budoh[]

Role: General, Budoh Majin Mob Leader

Motif: Manta Ray, Samurai

Manta rays are large cold-blooded fish belonging to the Mobulidae family. They are most well-known for their flat diamond-shaped bodies. Their name means "blanket" in Spanish.

The samurai were the hereditary military, nobility, and officer caste of medieval Japan from the 12th century to their abolition in 1876. Serving their daimyo, they were prestigious warriors who used the bushido arts to slay their enemies with a sword. While the traditional way of the samurai has ended, the memory of their time remains a constant presence in Japanese pop culture and modern culture worldwide.

Etymology: Budoh's name is likely based on "budo", the Japanese term for martial arts. The name might also be a pun on the Japanese word for the wharf (futo), which is a structure on the shore of a harbor where ships may dock to load and unload cargo or passengers.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Treacheron

Spectral Empress Illiess[]

Role: General, Iliess Majin Tribe Leader

Motif: Egyptian Pharaoh

The pharaoh is defined as the rulers of Ancient Egypt around the time of 3100 BC, who according to their religion served as a medium between the gods and the people of Egypt. The title was not used by the Egyptians themselves until around 1200 BC, the term "king" being used instead. The word derives from an Egyptian compound word meaning 'great house'.

Etymology: Illiess' name is likely based on the Japanese word for an inlet (irie), which is an indention of a shoreline, and Osiris.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Hexuba

Destruction King Battobas[]

Role: General, Battobas Majin Corps

Motif: Viking

Vikings are a modern name for a type of seafaring people hailing from Scandinavia that raided, pirated, and settled throughout much of Europe. They are the namesake of the Viking Age (late 8th to late 11th century AD). They were known for speaking Old Norse, sailing in longships across vast oceans and their horned helmets (which actually is historically inaccurate). The modern romanticisation of Vikings as noble savages emerged during the 18th century and has allowed them to become a staple of modern pop culture. The exact etymology of the word is currently unknown.

Etymology: Battobas' name is likely based on "buttobasu" (a Japanese verb meaning to strike) and the Japanese word for the quay (hatoba), which is another word for a wharf.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Barbarax

Dark Merchant Biznella[]

Role: Merchant

Motif: Pierrot

Etymology: Biznella's name is likely a pun on the word "business".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Deviot

Garvourer[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Gargoyle, King Vulture, Bird Skeleton

The gargoyle is a monster from horror and fantasy fiction based on the architectural element of the same name. They are associated as magically animated stone creatures who possess animal-like features and function as guardians for cathedrals or castles. Other interpretations portray them as ordinary gargoyles possessed by demons or living statues. The name is based on the French word "gargouille", which refers to the throat. One function of gargoyle statues is having them function as a fountain by spraying water out of their sculpted mouth, coming up from their throat.

The king vulture, Sarcoramphus papa, is a large bird found in Central and South America. It is a member of the New World vulture family Cathartidae. This vulture lives predominantly in tropical lowland forests stretching from southern Mexico to northern Argentina. It is the only surviving member of the genus Sarcoramphus.

There are fossil members of the genus that the king vulture belongs to, hence the skeletal features.

Garvourer's form also contains elements of a wolf, a king vulture, and a bird skull.

Etymology: Garvourer's name is based on the words "Gargoyle" and "devourer".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Dreadgoyle (Skullbird Mode)

This villain's name is a combination of the words "dread" (a feeling of great fear or apprehension) and "Gargoyle".

They are most known for their exceptionally loud song, which in Japan indicates the beginning of the summer season. In folklore, they are seen as symbols of carefree living and immortality. Most species are found in Asia, although some species are found in other continents. They are an aggressive species known commonly as a pest for their dangerous stings. The name of this species comes from a Proto-Indo-European word meaning 'the one with horns'.

Their common name comes from the Spanish word for the insect, "cucaracha".

Crickets are a type of nocturnal insect belonging to the Grylloidea superfamily that lives all over the world in a variety of habitats. They are most well known for producing chirping noises by rubbing their wings together. The singing of a cricket is seen in Brazilian culture as a sign of impending rain. Its name is derived from the Old French verb "criquer", meaning 'to crackle'.

Budoh Majin Gang[]

The Budoh Majin Gang is the second group of Majin faced by the Gingaman. They are themed around feudal Japan and are each modelled after a type of sea creature. They share disciplined and dignified personalities. They grow giant size by drinking Balban Extract out of a sake gourd. Their names are generally based on a combination of Japanese words.

Komuhachi[]

Motifs: Octopus, Komuso, Octopus Trap

The octopus is a soft-bodied mollusc of the Octopoda order. Their name is Latin for 'eight feet', a reference to their eight appendages called tentacles which they are most known for. Other traits include a beaked mouth, the spreading of ink for protection, and access to venom.

The Komuso are a group of Japanese monks who flourished during the Edo period. They are characterized by wearing a straw basket on their head, which symbolizes their humble loss of personal identity. Their name translates to "priest of nothingness".

Evil Plan: Infect Trees with Mold to force the Galaxy Lights out of them

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "komuso" and "shakuhachi" (a type of flute traditionally played by the Komuso).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Teksa

Fudasoushou[]

Motifs: Squid, Shinto Priest

Squid are a type of cephalopod found in the Decapodiformes superorder. They are predators who can use their tentacles to hold prey while using a beak to feast on their flesh. They swim using jet propulsion and can camouflage themselves by changing the color of their body. They are commonly consumed in Japan where they are cooked into different dishes called calamari. Their name is believed to be based on a variant of the word "squirt", referencing the ink they eject to distract predators.

Evil Plan: Use Talismans to find the Galaxy Lights

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "ofuda" (Shinto Talisman) and an alternative reading of "sojo" (the first rank of the Buddhist clergy).

Kemuemon[]

Motifs: Sea Urchin, Ishikawa Goemon

The sea urchin is the common name for the echinoderms of the Echinoidea class. They generally are round animals covered in sharp spines. The word urchin derives from the Middle English word "irchoun" which references the hedgehog.

Ishikawa Goemon is a legendary Japanese outlaw hero who used ninjutsu to steal gold from the rich to give to the poor. After a failed assassination attempt on the warlord Toyotomi Hideyoshi, he was executed by being boiled alive. Little historical information exists about Goemon's life, with his first appearance in historical records being in the biography of Toyotomi Hideyoshi. Goemon is the subject of many classic kabuki plays.

Evil Plan: Use a Bomb to uncover the Galaxy Lights

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "kemuri" (Smoke) and "Goemon".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Mutantrum

This name is most likely a combination of "mutant" and "tantrum".

Amehoshi[]

Motifs: Blowfish, Biwa Player, Sumo Wrestler

Tetraodontidae is a family of toxic marine fish that are known for their ability to inflate their body to massive sizes and their spike-covered bodies. Common names for species in this family include pufferfish and blowfish.

Sumo wrestling is a competitive sport where two opponents must push their foe outside of a marked ring. The name means "striking one another" in Japanese and is considered the national sport of the country.

Evil Plan: Summon the Galaxy Lights with a cursed song

Etymology: This character's name literally translates to "rain priest", likely based on "biwa hoshi" (a type of travelling performer from Japan's past).

Power Rangers Counterpart: None

Kugutsudayuu[]

Motifs: Starfish, Puppeteer

Starfish, also known as sea stars, are a group of star-shaped echinoderms of the Asteroidea class. They are marine invertebrates who possess five arms that they use to stick to surfaces.

A puppeteer is a person who manipulates an inanimate object (a puppet) to create the illusion that the object is in fact alive. Puppeteers can be visible or hidden from their audience and operate their puppet through a variety of methods (examples include usage of strings to indirectly control the puppets movements or placing one's hands inside the puppet). While moveable mouths are included in most puppets, they are usually used only for gestural expression and only sometimes will the puppeteer speak in the role of the puppet's character.

Evil Plan: Destroy Buildings with Explosive Puppets

Etymology: This name literally translates to "puppet performer".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Starcog

This name is likely based on "starfish" and "cog" (a metal wheel or bar used in machinery, similar to a gear).

Kairikibou[]

Motifs: Coral, Benkei, Sohei/Warrior Monk

Saito Musashibo Benkei, more commonly known as simply Benkei, was a Japanese sohei/warrior monk who lived during the Heian Period. It is said that he wandered around Kyoto on a personal quest to take 1000 swords from samurai that he defeated in a duel as a sign of their arrogance. After collecting 999 swords, he would lose a duel against Minamoto no Yoshitsune on the Gojo Bridge and become his retainer. Benkei is also legendary for actually having died standing up while defending Yoshitsune from an army at the castle of Koromogawa no tate. He is regarded in modern times as a man of great strength and loyalty as well as being a popular subject in Japanese folklore.

Evil Plan: Open the "Oni Stone" containing the Galaxy Lights

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "hakairiki" (Japanese for Destructive Force) and "bo" (Japanese suffix for a monk).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Samuron

Crabs are decapod crustaceans of the Brachyura infraorder. They possess thick exoskeletons and a pair of pincers. The name is believed to derive from the Proto-Germanic word "krabbo" which means 'crawling'.

Kabuki (literally meaning 'the skill of singing and dancing' based on the kanji used) is a classical form of Japanese dramatic theater known for its heavily-stylized performances, the glamorous costumes worn by performers, and the elaborate kumadori make-up worn by some performers. It originated during the very early Edo period and its credited founder is the shrine maiden Izumo no Okuni, with the art form developing further throughout the late 17th century and reaching its zenith in the mid-18th century.

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "taihou" (Japanese for a cannon) and "Retsudo Gisen" (a priest living in the Edo period).

Lobsters are large marine crustaceans belonging to the Nephropidae family. They are highly prized as seafood and are very profitable in many coastal areas. Their name likely derives from the Latin word "locusta", which refers to all crustaceans.

The samurai were the hereditary military, nobility, and officer caste of medieval Japan from the 12th century to their abolition in 1876. Serving their daimyo, they were prestigious warriors who used the bushido arts to slay their enemies with a sword. While the traditional way of the samurai has ended, the memory of their time remains a constant presence in Japanese pop culture and modern culture worldwide.

They are named after the distinctive shape of their heads, which are flat and resemble a hammer.

Medusa, according to legend, lived on the island of Sarpedon until she was beheaded by the hero Perseus who used it as a personal weapon before giving it to the goddess Athena. Her name is derived from a Greek word meaning "guardian".

A knight is an honorary title given to a military soldier that is meant to serve the monarch of a country or organization. During the Early Middle Ages of Europe, the title most often was given to warriors who rode on horseback and possessed a code of chivalry that they took very seriously. They served their master as a personal bodyguard, an elite fighter, or a mercenary who killed for money. The word most likely is based on the Old English word "cniht", which refers to a servant.

Mummies are commonly featured in horror as undead creatures wrapped in bandages. They originate from Ancient Egyptian tradition, where the body of the deceased would be processed through "mummification" to prepare them for the journey to the afterlife.

Evil Plan: Extract Beauty from 81 virgins

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "morugu" (Japanese pronunciation of the word morgue).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Crummummy

This name is likely based on a fusion of the words "crummy" and "mummy".

Hielahiela[]

Motif: Fallen Angel

A fallen angel is a term used in some Abrahamic religions for specific messengers of God who have been cast out of heaven, often for rebelling or committing sin. The actual term can not be found in the Bible, with the concept originating from Christian theology instead. The most famous of the fallen angels is Lucifer, the former archangel who became the Christian devil.

Evil Plan: Freeze 111 souls with her bow and arrow

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "hieru" (Japanese verb meaning 'to cool down').

Power Rangers Counterpart: Icy Angel

Barukibaruki[]

Motif: Yeti

The Yeti, also known to Western audiences as the Abominable Snowman, is a very well-known cryptid who originated from Himalayan folklore in Asia. It is a ape-like creature coated in white fur and living in cold environments. It is often compared to Bigfoot, both of which being arguably the most famous and sought-after cryptids in the world. Its name derives from the language of Tibet, meaning 'rocky bear'.

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "baruki" (Japanese pronunciation of bulky).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Hardtochoke

This character's name is likely based on a fusion of "hard" and "artichoke".

Gaaragaara[]

Motif: Kali, Asura

Kali, also known as Kalika, is a Hindu goddess thought to be the goddess of ultimate power, time, destruction, and change. Traditionally, she is seen as a form of the Mahadevi (the supreme goddess of Shaktism, a sect of Hinduism) and is the first of the ten Mahavidyas. Kali is the ultimate manifestation of Shakti, the mother of all living things, and the destroyer of evil. Her name is the feminine form of the Sanskrit word for time.

Asura are a class of beings in Indic religions (most commonly Hinduism and Buddhism) described as power-seeking clans who are constantly at war with another race called the devas. They are powerful superhuman demigods often divided into good asuras and evil ones. Their name is thought to come from the Sanskrit word "Asu", which refers to departed spirits.

Evil Plan: Read the palms of 333 humans

Etymology: Unknown

Power Rangers Counterpart: None

Merudameruda[]

Motif: Lamia

The Lamia is a female demon from Greek mythology that is traditionally depicted as a snake-like creatures with the features of a female human. One myth tells of the Lamia being a woman cursed by Hera after her husband Zeus showed affection towards her. She was treated as a boogeyman-type figure to scare children into behaving, believing that the Lamia would devour them if they didn't behave. Its name is claimed by the Ancient Greeks to derive from the word "laimos", which refers to her large throat.

Evil Plan: Trap 22 people inside her necklace

Etymology: This character's name is likely based on "meruda" (Japanese pronunciation of murder).

Power Rangers Counterpart: Maronda

Desphias[]

Motif: Egyptian Pharaoh

The pharaoh is defined as the rulers of Ancient Egypt around the time of 3100 BC, who according to their religion served as a medium between the gods and the people of Egypt. The title was not used by the Egyptians themselves until around 1200 BC, the term "king" being used instead. The word derives from an Egyptian compound word meaning 'great house'.

Evil Plan: Harness the sadness of 3,333 people

Etymology: Unknown

Power Rangers Counterpart: Rykon

Created and owned by GamepadtheDreamer

Motif: Genie

Djinn is a very broad term for a spirit in Islamic mythology. They are often portrayed as malicious, but are sometimes considered benevolent. They are nowadays mostly associated with the Arabian folktale Aladdin and the Magic Lamp.

Evil Plan: Grant 75 wishes

Etymology: This character's name is based on "nozomu" (Japanese verb meaning 'To wish').

Created and owned by Mariooto

A fairy is a type of mythological being from European cultures. They are generally enchanted spirits with magical powers that are either benevolent or tricksters.

Created and owned by Mariooto

The mermaid is an aquatic creature that appears in various folklores throughout the world. It is often depicted as a human woman whose lower body is that of a fish. Their name means 'sea girl' or 'sea woman' in Old English.

Evil Plan: To create whirlpools and drain all the waters on Earth

Etymology: This character's name is based on "ningyo" (Japanese word for 'Mermaid')

Power Rangers Counterpart: Poison Plant

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Golem

A golem is an animated, anthropomorphic being in Jewish folklore, which is entirely created from inanimate matter, usually clay or mud. The most famous golem narrative involves Judah Loew ben Bezalel, the late 16th-century rabbi of Prague.

Evil Plan: Bury people with a colossal rockslide (true plan, uncover the location of the Ginga Shadows).

Etymology: This character's name is based on "gÅremu" (Japanese word for 'Golem')

Power Rangers Counterpart: Rumbolem

This Villain's name is a combination of rumble and golem.

Kurakenkuraken[]

Created and owned by R4veg0yl3

Motif: Kraken

Originating in Scandinavian folklore, the kraken is usually depicted as an aggressive cephalopod-like creature capable of destroying entire ships and dragging sailors to their doom.

Evil Plan: Steal the souls of the Gingamen by using the power of the Ginga Shadows.

Etymology: This character's name is based on "kurÄken" (Japanese word for 'Kraken')

Power Rangers Counterpart: Abyssopod

This Villain's name is a combination of abyss and cephalopod.

Battobas Majin Gang[]

The Battobas Majin Gang is the fourth and final group of Majin faced by the Gingaman. They are themed around robots and are each modelled after a different weapon used in war. They act like a disciplined military unit, being the most organized of the four gangs. They grow giant size by drinking Balban Extract out of an ale barrel. Their names are simple corruptions of English words.

Bammers[]

Motif: Hammer

A hammer is a tool consisting of a weighted "head" attached to a long handle which is swung to deliver an impact to a small object. Common uses for hammers include driving nails into wood, shaping metal, and crushing rock. Other types of hammer such as sledgehammers and the war hammer can be used as a weapon. The usage of hammers can be traced back as far back as 3.3 million years ago, during the earliest days of human intelligence.

Evil Plan: Create pacemaker for Daitanix out of glass

Etymology: This name is likely based on "bam" (onomatopoeia for hitting hard) and "hammers".

Power Rangers Counterpart: None

Bombs[]

Motif: Cannon

Evil Plan: Plant 30 bombs in Tokyo to heat up a healing ore for Daitanix's heart

Etymology: This name is simply the English word "bombs".

Power Rangers Counterpart: Cannonbrawl

This name is likely based on a fusion of the words "cannonball" and "brawl".

Cobies[]

Motif: Medieval Knight

A knight is an honorary title given to a military soldier that is meant to serve the monarch of a country or organization. During the Early Middle Ages of Europe, the title most often was given to warriors who rode on horseback and possessed a code of chivalry that they took very seriously. They served their master as a personal bodyguard, an elite fighter, or a mercenary who killed for money. The word most likely is based on the Old English word "cniht", which refers to a servant.

Evil Plan: Kill GoTaurus and extract his heart

Etymology: Unknown

Power Rangers Counterpart: Chameliac

This name is likely based on a corruption of the word "chameleon".

Magdus[]

Motif: Magnet

Evil Plan: Kidnap children to clean Daitanix's veins

Etymology: This name is likely based on the word "magnet" and the given name Magnus.

Power Rangers Counterpart: Magnetox

A tank is an armored fighting vehicle used as an offensive weapon during front-line ground combat. They are a mainstay of modern military battles thanks to their heavy firepower, impressive durability, and good mobility. In modern language, the word refers to anything that is considered especially tough and/or powerful.

Etymology: Unknown

Power Rangers Counterpart: Ironite
